flawed_nl_solution:
If Pedro has 3 times more gumballs than Alicia, he has 3 * 20 gumballs = <<3*20=60>>60 gumballs more
In total, Pedro has 20 gumballs + 60 gumballs = <<20+60=90>>90 gumballs
When they put their gumballs together, the total number of gumballs in the bowl becomes 20 gumballs + 90 gumballs = <<20+90=110>>110 gumballs
Pedro takes out 40/100 of the gumballs which is 40/100 * 110 gumballs = <<40/100*110=44>>44 gumballs.
The number of gumballs remaining is 110 gumballs - 44 gumballs = <<110-44=66>>66 gumballs
#### 66

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 80, not 90. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
